com.saggezza.jtracker.track

Interface GenericTracker

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TrackerC

    public interface GenericTracker
    GenericTracker Interface The generic tracker interface is used to track whatever unstructured data in tabular form. TrackerC is the implementing class. Logs must be written to a separate location than the other trackers information, due to structural differences in the final data processing steps. TODO: Add a specific url for location to write to HDFS. TODO: Add fields to track_generic.
    See Also:
    TrackerC

    • Method Detail

      • setupTrack

        void setupTrack(String user_id)
        This command should be used before calling a track command of any sort if analytics is desired. Keeping it separate allows configuration of the user_id from the client side.
        Parameters:
        user_id - The current user of the JavaPlow tracker as used in analytics.

      • track

        void track()
           throws URISyntaxException,
                  IOException
        The basic track command. All other track functions eventually call this. The function compiles all the parameters in the PayloadMap into a proper URI which then is made into a HttpGet instance. The GET request is then sent to the collector URI where it is logged.
        Throws:
        URISyntaxException
        IOException

      • trackGenericEvent

        void trackGenericEvent(String eventVendor,
                     String eventName,
                     Map<String,Object> dictInfo,
                     String context)
                       throws JSONException,
                              IOException,
                              URISyntaxException
        Track an unstructured event.
        Parameters:
        eventVendor - The vendor the the event information.
        eventName - A name for the unstructured event being tracked.
        dictInfo - The unstructured information being tracked in dictionary form.
        context - Additional JSON context for the tracking call (optional)
        Throws:
        JSONException - If JSON is in improper formatting
        IOException - If there is an issue with the tracking call.
        URISyntaxException - If there is an issue with processing the HTTP GET

      • setContractors

        void setContractors(PlowContractor<Integer> integerContractor,
                  PlowContractor<String> stringContractor,
                  PlowContractor<Map<String,Object>> dictionaryContractor)
        Set Contractors Not required, but useful if you want to make a contractor with a custom checker for processing. Requires three inputs, a contractor class of each type.
        Parameters:
        integerContractor - A contractor of type integer.
        stringContractor - A contractory of type String
        dictionaryContractor - A Contractor of type Map with key value of String, Object

      • setParam

        void setParam(String param,
            String val)
        Used to add custom parameter. Be careful with use, must abide by saggezza table standards. See saggezza documentation
        Parameters:
        param - Parameter to be set.
        val - Value for the parameter.

      • setPlatform

        void setPlatform(String platform)
        Set the platform for the tracking instance. (optional) The default platform is PC.
        Parameters:
        platform - The platform being tracked, currently supports "pc", "tv", "mob", "cnsl", and "iot".

      • setUserID

        void setUserID(String userID)
        Set the uesrID parameter (optional)
        Parameters:
        userID - The User ID String.

      • setScreenResolution

        void setScreenResolution(int width,
                       int height)
        Set the screen resolution width and height (optional)
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the screen in pixels.
        height - Height of the screen in pixels.

      • setViewport

        void setViewport(int width,
               int height)
        Set the viewport of the screen.
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the viewport in pixels.
        height - Height of the viewport in pixels.

      • setColorDepth

        void setColorDepth(int depth)
        Set the color depth (optional)
        Parameters:
        depth - Depth of the color.

      • setTimezone

        void setTimezone(String timezone)
        Set the timezone (optioanl)
        Parameters:
        timezone - Timezone where tracking takes place.

      • setLanguage

        void setLanguage(String language)
        Set the language (optional)
        Parameters:
        language - Language for info tracked.

      • getPayload

        PayloadMap getPayload()
        Get the payload, use if you want to understand how it is set up.
        Returns:
        Returns the payload, can be used with caution to customize parameters.
